title: Merging Emails From Different Computers
content:
Hi. I have Thunderbird running on two, different computers. The older computer has many emails I'd like to merge on to the newer computer with Thunderbird.

Does anyone know how to do this? All I've been able to find is a solution that overwrites the emails of one or the other profile folders. I'd like to merge.

Thanks.

title: Thunderbird version 128.11.0esr
content:
I am currently running Thunderbird version 128.11.0esr on Windows 11 on a Dell desktop computer.

I have been running Thunderbird for years. But back in February 2025 my previous Dell desktop died, so had to purchase a new Dell desktop running Windows 11. Then I downloaded Thunderbird and installed it on the new desktop then copied over the profiles that fortunately had been backed up just a week prior. It has been working fine. (When I installed the Thunderbird on the new computer I did not realize there was a difference between ESR (Extended Support Release) channel and Release channel; I just downloaded and installed what I came upon.)

However, around 5/28/25 got a pop-up message that stated something to the effect it is recommended I upgrade to Thunderbird Release.

Should I download and install a new Thunderbird from the Release channel? Will the existing profiles work with the Release channel Thunderbird? Thank you for your help.
creator: jpwvols

title: drag and dropped messages into new folder but they disappeared
content:
I created a new Inbox sub-folder and then selected 19 messages in the Indox and dragged/dropped them into the new folder. They never showed up, but the new folder heading shows there are 19 messages in the folder. If they are there they are not visible. And they are gone from the Inbox.

I can't find a way to search the entire Inbox to see if they are in a different sub-folder, but I've checked the nearby sub-folders and they aren't there. Nor in the Trash or Junk folders. I've also tried the index repair for the new sub-folder and also the Inbox. That didn't help. I also closed out Thunderbird and restarted it, That didn't help either.

Any suggestions? 

John
creator: jbclem

title: Newsgroup Subscriptions lost after windows crash
content: Folks, If the power to my PC fails whilst I am reading a Newsgroup, the list of subscribed newsgroups for that news server is lost. This doesn't happen very often but its a pain when it does. Dave

title: Thunderbird stopped receiving emails from AOL.
content: Thunderbird stopped receiving emails from AOL. Stopped a few days ago and suddenly started working a few hours later. Now it has stopped for days. I cannot send messages from Thunderbird AOL account. Thunderbird does work with the Gmail account I have setup inThunderbird. What happened?

title: Messages on Yahoo server are gone after copying them to my local folders
content: Hi, When installing my Yahoo account in F-bird, I chose the option to keep copies of the messages on the server when downloading them to my local folders. But all my message folders on the yahoo server appear to be empty after I copied them to my local folders. Can this be undone? I'm using other email programs on my mobiles and it's crucial for me that I can access all my folders from mobile and desktop devices. Is there a way to keep them on the yahoo server AND have them synchronized with my local folders? Your help is very much appreciated! Kind regards, Pat

title: Thunderbird as the operating system default under Win 11
content: Hi! I'm trying to set Thunderbird as the operating system default under Win 11. I tried to follow Mozilla's instructions: 1. Open the Settings application by pressing and releasing the Windows Start button, then clicking the gear icon. 2. Click the Apps icon, then click Default Apps in the list. 3. Click the icon under the heading Email to show your choices. 4. Select Thunderbird. The trouble is that at n. 3 there is no choice. There is only 'OutlookAccounts' and this item cannot be deleted or replaced. Can you help? All the best, Robifiori
creator: Robifiori
